The line `N, i = map(int, input().split())` reads two integers from the input separated by a space. The `map` function applies the `int` function to each element of the input, converting them to integers. The line `j = N - i + 1` calculates the position of the car from the back. This is done by subtracting the position of the car from the front (i) from the total number of cars (N) and adding 1.

N, i = map(int, input().split())
print(N - i + 1)


This program reads two integers N and i from the input, and prints the value of j such that the i-th car from the front of the train is the j-th car from the back. The value of j is calculated by subtracting i from N and then adding 1.

Note: The input() function reads a line from input (typically user input), split() function splits the line into words, and map() function applies a function (in this case, int() function) to every word, resulting in a sequence of integers. The print() function then outputs the result.

This solution assumes that the input is always valid and does not handle errors. If you need to handle errors, you can add error checking code.

The time complexity of this solution is O(1) because it performs a constant number of operations regardless of the size of N. The space complexity is also O(1) because it uses a constant amount of space.

 - 1 \leq N \leq 100
 - 1 \leq i \leq N

-----Input-----
Input is given from Standard Input in the following format:
N i

-----Output-----
Print the answer.

-----Sample Input-----
4 2

-----Sample Output-----
3

The second car from the front of a 4-car train is the third car from the back.
